document_data.name: Gulzindar Street
document_data.mainbody: '''Gulzindar Street''' was a cobblestone paved avenueIn the map included in the 1{{st}}-edition accessory ''[[City System]]'', this location's name was misprinted as "Gulzind'''e'''r Street".
document_data.Locations:
[[File:Field of Triumph's Gate.png||thumb|275px|''Crowds of people flock down Gulzindar Street towards the Lion Gate of the Fields of Triumph.'']]
The right end of Gulzindar Street terminated on [[Haltovar Street]]. Up until the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]], its left end terminated on [[the Lions]] road. By [[1368 DR]], that section of road was re-designated as part of [[Jelzar's Stride]].

At its midsection, Gulzindar Street was fully intersected by [[Darselune Street]]. The road also acted as the northern terminus of [[Caldwell Street]] and the southern terminus of [[Seawatch Street]].
document_data.Notable Locations: * The [[Field of Triumph]]'s famed Lion Gate entrance stood at the left end of Gulzindar Street.
